Simple idea

tldr; Invest now to do more tomorrow or do more today. You can invest time in becoming more productive now or instead use that time to perform work. Lets use a simple model to explore this trade-off. You have a base productivity \(w_0\). You can invest \(C_p\) today to be \(p_r\) more productive tomorrow. mathematically: \[ w_{t+1} = w_t.(1 + p_r) \] or \[ w_{t+1} = w_0.(1 + p_r)^t \] so over period t the amount of work done is: \[ TW_{t} = \sum_{j=0}^{j=t}w_0.(1 + p_r)^j - C_p.t \] the term \(C_p.t\) represents the investment in time to get a productivity increase p_r in the next period.
